an4.104:1.3: One is shallow but appears deep,
an4.104:1.4: one is deep but appears shallow,
an4.104:1.5: one is shallow and appears shallow, and
an4.104:1.6: one is deep and appears deep.
an4.104:1.8: In the same way, these four people similar to lakes are found in the world.
an4.104:1.10: One is shallow but appears deep,
an4.104:1.11: one is deep but appears shallow,
an4.104:1.12: one is shallow and appears shallow, and
an4.104:1.13: one is deep and appears deep.
an4.104:2.1: And how is a person shallow but appears deep?
an4.104:2.2: It’s when a person is impressive when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and aside, when bending and extending the limbs, and when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes.
an4.104:2.3: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an4.104:2.4: That’s how a person is shallow but appears deep.
an4.104:2.5: That person is like a lake that’s shallow but appears deep, I say.
an4.104:3.1: And how is a person deep but appears shallow?
an4.104:3.2: It’s when a person is not impressive …
an4.104:3.3: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.104:4.1: And how is a person shallow and appears shallow?
an4.104:4.2: It’s when a person is not impressive …
an4.104:4.3: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.104:5.1: And how is a person deep and appears deep?
an4.104:5.2: It’s when a person is impressive …
an4.104:5.3: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.104:5.7: These four people similar to lakes are found in the world.”
